messages.message:
I’ll just tack onto this that the Docsbot itself does answer the question:

> When creating automation apps, the following field types are available:
> 
> 1. **Derived Field**: This field type allows you to generate values based on preceding fields in the class. For example, you can identify the state in a customer address.
> 
> 2. **List Extraction Fields**: These fields allow for the extraction of multiple attributes. The number of allowed attributes has been increased from 10 to 30, although accuracy may degrade with more than 10 attributes.
> 
> 3. **Document Reasoning Fields**: These fields include an “Enhance prompt” option that optimizes your prompt for clarity, concision, and coherence while eliminating contradictions and redundancies.
> 
> 4. **Custom Function Field**: This field type lets you compute values or import third-party data directly into your project schema.
> 
> These field types are designed to enhance the flexibility and functionality of automation apps by allowing for complex data extraction and processing.
@jayasooryan is checking with the new embedding model to see whether the above issue is fixed
@jean Is that the entirety of the docsbot response? Because there are 7 field types.
oh, bummer, because yes, it was
Well, if I dig into more and ask if there are only four field types, it does give me the right number… but if you didn’t know to dig in, you wouldn’t know.
